Description: The Temptation of St Antony; the saint seated at a table under a shelter at right, being attacked by grotesque devilish creatures and tempted by two women, behind a church and other buildings and a figure hanging at the gallows Pen and brown ink, with grey-brown wash, over black chalk
Curator's comments: A stylistically similar drawing, signed by Francken, is in the Albertina, Vienna, inv.no.7971 (witch scene). It is probably an early sheet, influenced in the hatching by Jan Brueghel I. A painting of the same subject was sold at Christie's Amsterdam in November 2002 (sale 2566, lot 51) as Circle of Jakob Isaacsz. van Swanenburgh (formerly attributed to School of Hieronymus Bosch). See also the drawing of the same subject dated c.1605 with the dealer Thomas le Claire in 2010, catalogue no. 26, no.1 (Hamburg, 2010). Literature: M. Winner, in 'Pieter Breughel d. Ä. als Zeichner', exh.cat. Kupferstichkabinett Berlin, 1975, cat.no.154 (as Frans Francken II); Laura Ritter in 'Tales of the City: Drawing in the Netherlands from Bosch to Bruegel' exh. cat. Cleveland Museum of Art, 2022, fig. 41 (as Frans Francken II).
Bibliographic references: Phillipps-Fenwick 1935 / Catalogue of drawings in the collection of T Fitzroy Phillipps-Fenwick (p.185(1))
Exhibition history: 1975, Berlin, Kupferstichkabinett, 'Pieter Bruegel als Zeichner' cat. no. 154 2014-15 Sept - Jan.London, BM, Witches and Wicked Bodies
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Samuel Woodburn (Christie's, 4.vi.1860/94 as 'Brueghel - A village festival - bistre wash; Savery - Soldiers sacking a village; and Bosch - The temptation of St Anthony - bistre', 3 in the lot, bt Phillipps £2-16-0)
